TitleText: 2	Church of Scientology imprisoned her for twelve years
LeftText: 4	Valeska Paris , an Australian woman and former Scientologist , has claimed
5	that the Church of Scientology imprisoned her for twelve years aboard the Scientology - owned cruise ship , Freewinds .
6	The Church of Scientology 's cruise ship Freewinds in Bonaire .
7	Paris was born in Switzerland
8	but her parents moved her to the United Kingdom
9	when she was six
10	so they could be closer to the church 's headquarters .
11	She joined the Sea Org
12	aged 14 .
13	In 1995 , at age seventeen , she was told to disconnect from her mother .
4	Valeska Paris , an Australian woman and former Scientologist , has claimed
5	that the Church of Scientology imprisoned her for twelve years aboard the Scientology - owned cruise ship , Freewinds .
6	The Church of Scientology 's cruise ship Freewinds in Bonaire .
RightText: 7	Paris was born in Switzerland
8	but her parents moved her to the United Kingdom
9	when she was six
10	so they could be closer to the church 's headquarters .
11	She joined the Sea Org
12	aged 14 .
13	In 1995 , at age seventeen , she was told to disconnect from her mother .

LeftText: 7	Paris was born in Switzerland
8	but her parents moved her to the United Kingdom
9	when she was six
10	so they could be closer to the church 's headquarters .
RightText: 11	She joined the Sea Org
12	aged 14 .
13	In 1995 , at age seventeen , she was told to disconnect from her mother .
14	Paris claims
15	she was first sent to the ship
16	aged eighteen
17	for two weeks as a teenager
18	but ended up spending twelve years there .
19	Paris also claims
20	that her passport was taken away from her
21	and she was forced to work in the engine room .
22	I was basically hauled in
23	and told that my mum had attacked the church
24	and that I needed to disconnect from her
25	because she was suppressive .
26	Valeska Paris
27	I was basically hauled in
28	and told that my mum had attacked the church
29	and that I needed to disconnect from her
30	because she was suppressive .
31	Her mother had spoken out against Scientology on French television
32	after her ex-husband and Paris 's father , Albert Jaquier , committed suicide
33	after he lost his fortune to Scientology .
34	Paris claims
35	that she was kept at Flag Land Base in Clearwater , Florida
36	until she was eighteen
37	and then transferred to the Freewinds .
38	On board the Freewinds , Paris claims
39	that she was working from 6:00am to midnight
40	and due to lack of sleep ended up being a walking zombie .
41	She also claims
42	that in 1997 and 1998 , she was tasked with removal of asbestos from the ship .
43	In 2007 , Paris left the ship after a confrontation with the ship 's management .
44	She was eventually sent to Rehabilitation Project Force in Sydney ,
45	which the Church describes as a religious retreat ,
46	but critics charge is a forced work camp .
47	Here , she met her future husband
48	and subsequently left the church .
49	In a statement to the Australian Broadcasting Corporation , the Church denied these allegations :
50	She certainly was n't ' forced ' to be there .
51	She was also never forced to perform labour in the engine room .
52	They also claimed
53	Paris was a volunteer
54	and claim
55	she has a vested interest for misrepresenting her experiences with the Church .
56	The Church also claims
57	that Paris not having her passport was maritime procedure .
